subject: [junit] Testing SQL: was Test-first paper
msgSnippet: Surely the only way to test SQL is to use a database. Imagine testing java code by parsing it rather than running it. Maybe CMP EJBs make this a lot easier.
messageBody:
Surely the only way to test SQL is to use a database. Imagine testing
java code by parsing it rather than running it. Maybe CMP EJBs make this
a lot easier.

> From: "Johannes Link" <john.link@...>
> > - Testing that the SQL is right requires some kind of
> SQL-Parser. It's not a
> > problem for static SQL strings but it is one when SQL code is somehow
> > assembled dynamically - which was the case in the example I had
> chosen and which
> > seemed to be natural when striving for the simples thing.
>
> From: Steve Freeman [mailto:steve@...]
> Agreed, parsing SQL for tests is a Bad Idea. We got into mock
> objects in the first place to avoid parsing HTML. What's the
> smallest thing you could say about a given SQL string that gives
> you enough confidence to continue? Matching a couple of substrings?
>

-- Neil Swingler
